Reviews.Title: “Helpful”
Reviews.Author: SarahSHU
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel in August for 2 days. We had a nice stay here. Location was nice and super quiet at night, staff were polite and helpful with directions. It was a nice bonus to have water and expressor machine in lobby. The computers and free wifi worked excellent! The room was comfortable but the only con was no bathroom door, it was just a curtain to close off the bathroom. Overall very good! Def would stay here again:)

Reviews.Title: “Great find!”
Reviews.Author: catsinbrooklyn
Reviews.Content: Agree with most of the reviewers: location, facility, staff, service. I stayed at Chic and Basic in Amsterdam twice- this one was nothing like it! So much better. I wish I knew about this place last time I was in Madrid. Btw, I got a great summer weekend deal. 108€ for two nights (July 2012) you can't beat that!

Reviews.Title: “Love, love, love this place!!!”
Reviews.Author: cap1976
Reviews.Content: Location: Great, great, great location, within a short walking distance from Atocha train station and Reina Sofia museum. Close to Retiro park and Prado museum, plaza Mayor and San Miguel market, and a thousand other "must see" places...could not have picked a better area to "get to and from". Room: Our room was just as the name says, chic and basic...and super clean, with everything being so crispy white, you'd notice right away if it wasn't. Even though it faced the busy street, we had no trouble sleeping, with the windows closed and the a/c on...of course. The rooms may not have balconies, however the windows are basically double-doors that open up onto a railing. Perk: If you're looking to relax outside while having a beer after running around all day, you can always grab a few cold ones at the nearby store, before asking the front desk for the key to the private roof-top terrace on your way back up, and enjoy the sunset from the outdoor lounge. Staff: And the staff is fabulous. Everyone we came in contact with was attentive, courteous, friendly and helpful. Just a great overall stay, and in Madrid, a steal for the price!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good value, great location”
Reviews.Author: Stella G
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 2 nights: perfect location for our first trip to Madrid being so close to Reina Sofia and el Prado. The reception staff were all extremely helpful and friendly. We stayed on the top floor but unfortunately looked out into the internal courtyard/light-well rather than across the city's rooftops but never mind, the roof terrace was just down the hall. Our room was opposite the lift but therre was hardly any associated noise. The bed was big and comfortable, the wifi was free and very reliable, the shower was powerful enough but the drain needs sorting as the water didn't drain away quick enough and the bathroom flooded each time we showered, we could have done with more hooks for the towels but hey, it's not called Chic and Luxurious is it?

Reviews.Title: “good value great location helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: bostonmarc
Reviews.Content: i've stayed here 3 times in 3 different rooms and will return for the convience and the price. Wifi is free, desk staff friendly and helpful and the location so near el Prado, la Reina Sofia, Caixaforum and Calle de la Huertas just perfect. The rooms need a fresh coat of paint but otherwise everything's good.

Reviews.Title: “Rubbish”
Reviews.Author: nadinejane
Reviews.Content: Orange light in room and drunk people upstairs ruined it for me,reception did not know how to get rid of ligh t in room, took fuses out and card out to no avail, drunk people flushed chain 20 times and took 10 showers between 1.30 and 4.00 am, never again...

Reviews.Title: “Great location but simple”
Reviews.Author: EvaPrague
Reviews.Content: This place is in a great location if your goal is to visit the museums - Prado, Thyssen and MOMA are virtually around the corner. You can buy a ticket booklet in a ticket booth near Prado and then you dont have to queu for the tickets. The hotel is also close to Atocha station, from where you can go easily to Toledo. Toledo is definitely worth a visit as are the museums. The room was spacious, very clean, simple. It was in the ground floor, therefore there was no view at all, except a window facing a dark yard, that was a donwside of the room. There is a small seating area in the reception, where you can have a tea all day. Breakfasts are there, they are simple. If you have time definitely go to Retiro park, my favourite place in Madrid. Overall I would say this place is great for those who come to Madrid to visit the museums, or for a short stay, if you are on a budget, or a student, and not having big demands.

Reviews.Title: “An attractive, very convenient place for stopping over”
Reviews.Author: dpeck
Reviews.Content: We were passing through Madrid briefly on the way to Andalucia and wanted to stop over to visit the Prado, and this place had everything for our purposes. It was reasonably priced, in the off-season anyway, just a block up from the Atocha main railway station and two blocks over from the Prado, clean and well-appointed though basic (which is part of the point), and the staff were extraordinarily friendly and helpful. As an attractive and convenient place to stop over en route, I couldn’t recommend it more highly.

Reviews.Title: “you can do better for the price”
Reviews.Author: Rebrites
Reviews.Content: the location is great, the staff is friendly, but the room is minimalistic to the point of skeletal. White everything, which means the inevitable scuff-marks on the walls stand way out; having a curtain instead of a bathroom door means a bit too much intimacy when traveling with teenage children! I enjoyed the roof terrace, but having to run up and down to get the keys was a bit much. I asked for a quiet room, which meant a nice air-shaft view (I don´t mind that), but our door opened right onto the elevator door, too -- rather defeating the quietness request! Really liked having fruit and coffee in the lobby in the morning.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap & Basic”
Reviews.Author: MissLamb
Reviews.Content: Chic & Basic should be called Cheap & Basic because they are cheapskates. I am not sure why so many people have given this place such good reviews. My boyfriend and I recently stayed here, and our stay was anything but pleasant. Our room didn't have a door on the washroom, giving it prison like charm. When we asked why it didn't have a door the Hotel Attendant barked that 'doors are reserved for people who pay more,' we actually paid full price for our room. Also situated on the 2nd floor, our room was dirty and the smell of raw sewage steeped up through the shower drain and permeated our tiny box like room. Not to mention, this 2nd floor room faced the busy loud street of Atocha with none stop traffic and drunk people screaming throughout the night. I am sure that the cosmopolitan city of Madrid has much better accommodations in the same price range. I feel that this hotel chain spent too much money promoting itself as a cool destination for young travelers and skimped on important things like cleanliness, doors on washrooms and friendly staff. Perhaps if I would have known it is a one star ( 1 out of 4 stars), I would have thought twice before making my reservation. Cheap & Basic is a glorified Hostel. Well a Hostel without the glory. The only good thing, free espresso and a great location next to all the museums.

Reviews.Title: “Home away from home”
Reviews.Author: unusualusername
Reviews.Content: First time in this chain. I love the atmosphere and staff. The free tea, coffee, biscuits and fruit in the lobby make for a real nice feature, much better than the stuff you get in your room in more expensive hotels. It always hard to know what room you will get in the hotel. The rooms on the street side are definitely a little noisy but they face south and get lovely light in winter, higher up the better I guess. Traffic noise dies down from 12-7 anyway. Toilet in our room is in a corner out of sight but it is technically open plan You can actually use the shower door to close off the toilet. The rest of the rooms open on to internal light courts which are quieter but without a view !. Definitely go back here. Near Atocha train station and all the galleries and old Madrid. Make sure you get the Cercanias train from T4 to Atocha, it has just opened. No breakfeast here but the stuff in the lobby is a good start.

Reviews.Title: “TRUTH IN ADVERTSING”
Reviews.Author: alipg
Reviews.Content: This hotel is perfectly described in its name. Chic & Basic. If you like lush, elegantly decorated hotels, that cater to your every desire on a whim then this hotel is NOT for you. But if you like a perfectly located hotel, modern, convenient and with a terrific value, then this might be the hotel for you. We stayed at both the basic and the superior rooms (both double). The basic category is very small, but is modern and has every convenience just as the superior one. The superior category room was a lot more spacious and has a view of Atocha street. It wasn't noisy at all to us and we could sleep very well in both. There are a few minor details where either the hotel is showing its age, or the workmanship used was not the very best (the towel holder in the basic room comes to mind), but they were just minor details, and it did not bother us at all. The free wi-fi worked perfectly while we were there. There is no breakfast offered, but there is a self-service area in the lobby with coffee, tea, biscuits/cookies, fruit, & juice, that you can use 24/7. I must say, the coffee from the machine was pretty good, and so were the biscuits.The staff were courteous and professional; maybe a little short for American standards, but then again we found this to be the case in all of Madrid in general. The location was perfect. Just a short walk to the Atocha train station, the Anton Martin metro and even the Reina Sofia Museum. The Prado Museum is also not too far away if you feel like walking. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Chic, basic and cozy”
Reviews.Author: Sbjuliana
Reviews.Content: Don´t expect luxury on this hotel, but you can expect cozy roons and a sympathetic staff. The roons and the hotel is simple, but it´s a clean and chic minimalistic place, very warming and cute. I recommend for those who don´t want to spend to much, but still get style and a nice stay. And it´s really close to Atocha Train Station, the main station of trains and subway. It´s really worth it!

Reviews.Title: “very basic but gets job done”
Reviews.Author: WageandBabo
Reviews.Content: Hotel is certainly modern design, and very small rooms (it's basic) and has IKEA feeling decor. No breakfast, free coffee+tea and ice water 24 hours. Biscuits and fruit in front, but they don't give a bag with fruit (you help yourself) and there is a small area to sit in the lobby. Room 102 bathroom design needs improvement: the ledge of the shower is too low and water has damaged the floor/edge of shower. Not that this detracted from my stay but maybe the hotel management should invest in re-designing that to save itself the expense of water damage repair. Room 102 also smelled smoky (I thought it was a non-smoking hotel). Staff was very kind, and Maria is approachable and friendly. Hallways are lit based on motion-sensors, so it feels dark when you first enter. Lift was broken but surprisingly was fixed within a few hours (we did not believe it would be). Coffee machine makes decaf, latte, espresso, hot water, hot milk. Bathroom is separated from room by a curtain. Room faces street and is very noisy (if you don't like that). Sinks are VERY shallow (I think it is ikea design) but very wide (so not a problem for us). Room 402 was nicer, better bathroom design (door was to toilet), very quiet (window opens to center courtyard, no street noise), and no smoky smell. Location is near Atocha station, but a little bit uphill from atocha.

Reviews.Title: “More chic, less basic”
Reviews.Author: Deenie76
Reviews.Content: I came across Chic & Basic Atocha after seeing it written about on a travel blog. I decide I would copy the blogger's Madrid experience and stay there myself. I wasn't disappointed. First and foremost - the location. Very central, easy access to the metro, restaurants and clubs and most importantly, very easy to get to from the airport. Jump on the 24hr autobus from the airport (only 2 euros) and Atocha is the very last stop. The hotel is less than a ten minute walk from the bus station. The hotel is close to everything you'd need. If you fancy walking around to see the sights... its totally possible. We preferred to jump on the Madrid City Tour double bus (available from five mins away from the hotel door) which helped us to take in as much of the city as possible in the short two days we were there. Highlights include Mercado San Miguel (heavenly food market), Plaza Mayor, Puerta Del Sol and Chueca. Secondly, the hotel itself. Very clean, modern and minimalist. Lots of white, lots of art and I nice special touches like the exposed brick wall, fashion books and magazines in reception and the humorous messages on the room key cards. The 'help yourself' area where tea, coffee, biscuits and fruit were freely available any time of day or night. The cosy roof top terrace with amazing views of the city. The hotel staff were absolutely GREAT. Warm, welcoming and extremely helpful. Receptionist Maria in particular was awesome. Giving us tips on which bars and restaurants to go to depending on what sort of music/crowd we liked, and going as far as drawing directions on a map so that we could find them. Another lovely surprise was the bottle of bubbly and chocolates they gave me as a birthday present - nice touch! The only downside was the few insects we came across in the room on our last night. Two screaming women later, we managed to get a good nights sleep despite being scared [--]. All in all a fab experience, one that I would recommend to others.

Reviews.Title: “Another good stay at Chic & Basic”
Reviews.Author: orangeroof
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on our last night in Spain because it was close to the Atocha station where we came from Seville so that we could take the airport bus from the train station the next day. If you want to see the sights, it would be more convenient to stay at the Mayerling Chic & Basic where we have stayed before. It's your typical C & B, fun, clean, and hip, but with some changes since our last stay. Only the coffee and some cookies are free now. Everything else you have to pay for (juice, fruit, wine, water, etc). There are two laptops to use in the lobby. Not sure if they are free or not. The staff was helpful and friendly as usual. Our top floor room was tiny, with a bathroom that many Americans would not even fit in. I'm not kidding. It worked, but would fit one thin person at a time only. It was clean, with great towels and a good hair dryer. I love their soap. Good size shower and lots of hot water. There is a outdoor deck/terrace on the top floor. It was quite nice with good views of Madrid. Take the staircase if you get the chance. It is quite old and very interesting. Overall, we enjoyed out short stay. This hotel chain is always our first choice in any city where it is available.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and staff”
Reviews.Author: Joseatoro
Reviews.Content: I stayed with my partner at this hotel for a weekend trip and it was a very good experience. Rooms are small but well designed and clean. The hotel does have refreshment zone with free coffee & tea, and also fruit and biscuits, but no restaurant or cafeteria. The staff is very good, always ready to help. The location is great, you are a stone's throw from Atocha Rail Terminal, and so close to the Prado Museum and Reina Sofía Museum. Also, from the Huertas and Latina neighborhoods. As some tripadvisor reviewers stated we got an inside room instead of a street room and we slept very well, it seems a good advise because Atocha Street seems very noisy at nights. It is a very good choice to travel to Madrid and get a nice and very well located hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A weekend in Madrid with EVERYTHING booked full!”
Reviews.Author: Owen F
Reviews.Content: After going to a million places -- all booked for the weekend of Halloween, I finally tried Chic & Basic. Fortunately a room was available for both the nights I needed, and its truly my favorite location for doing the museums and sights nearby. Next to train station, metro, etc. The room is smallish by American standards, but well appointed. The coffee machine, fruit, etc in the lobby is a GREAT thing for a weary traveler tired of abusive and expensive coffee shops. Bedding is great, lighting good, beautiful terrace. Only complaint is the room is cold and I couldn't find heat -- however I'd just come from the beach! The staff is superb!

Reviews.Title: “Rather jolly, a good place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Jake H
Reviews.Content: Chic&basic Atocha we chose because it wasnt hideously expensive, and it was close to the Prado and Reina Sofia. We werent expecting much, but were pleasantly surprised - really nice, clean hotel, friendly and helpful staff, compact but very pleasant rooms with a lot of rather deft design touches (including a sensationally comfy bed, and air con). All things considered really quite impressive. And so handy for Madrid's main sights, as well as the train station (Atocha Renfe) to other major cities in Spain (we used it as a base for Toledo).

Reviews.Title: “Basic hotel, good value, very enjoyable”
Reviews.Author: Heather G
Reviews.Content: The chic and basic atocha hotel was the perfect location for us, as we used it as both a hotel in Madrid, but also as a base to take day-trips outside of Madrid via the Renfe AVE trains (of which the station is located a 5 min walk away). It is also located close to a couple of subway stops, making it very easy to navigate the city itself. The ammenities were exactly as advertised, and customer service was outstanding. The small frils of the iced water, espresso machine and food items in the front lobby were nice to have. The front desk staff were gracious enough to assist us (at no additional cost) in printing out our pre-reserved tickets for Museo del Prado, as well as getting us another room when our air-conditioning stopped functioning in the sweltering Madrid summer heat. Overall, a very comfortable and pleasant stay. I would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Stay. Great Location. Amazing!”
Reviews.Author: Oren G
Reviews.Content: The Chic and Basic Atocha has everything for the economic traveller that wants amenities. The rooms were comfortable, well laid out with fantasic a/c (to battle the Madrid heat). Check-in was easy and the staff was amazing and helpful. They solved handled inquiries well and solved issues quickly with no excuses. The front lobby included complimentary fresh fruits /cookies to nibble on, an ice machine with cold water to cool you down from the Madrid heat, and latte/cappuccino/espresso to wake you up in the morning! Chic and Basic Atocha was perfect with easy access to the metro and art museum. Most downtown locations were no more than a twenty minute walk away. The street noise can be a nuisance (but you're going to run into that problem with any hotel in Madrid) but comfortable beds with light blocking drapes made it easy to fall into a deep sleep. I would highly recommend Chic and Basic Atocha!

Reviews.Title: “Everything you need for a short city break”
Reviews.Author: edujen
Reviews.Content: This hotel has everything you need for a short city break. The rooms are small but well designed -all the essentials are provided- a good comfortable bed, beautiful crisp white linen, a great shower yet you are not paying for extra unnecessary items. I loved the roof terrace and the free tea, coffee available 24/7 in the reception. The fresh fruit was also a nice touch. It is well located close to the station and airport bus and a short walk from the art galleries.

Reviews.Title: “Classy, accessible, and affordable”
Reviews.Author: liesl_3
Reviews.Content: I loved staying at chic&basic located right in the center of Madrid. Close to the park, shopping, and museums. The rooms were very clean and the bed was super comfortable. The staff were really helpful and could speak English as well. There was a nice common area with free cafe con leche which you could take out on the terrace to enjoy. Internet access was available as well. Highly recommendable!

Reviews.Title: “The art of doing the basic things well done”
Reviews.Author: lady_samhain
Reviews.Content: It´s a very cute hotel, with a welcoming staff - it´s basic, but it´s the art of doing the basic things well done. It began even before I arrived - I booked with a special rate but they had problems in charging my credit card and both of us or Visa couldn´t fix it (and we really tryed a lot). But, to my surprise, they were very solicitous and proposed that I could pay it in check in, with no extra charge. I asked a room not facing the street because I´ve read here in Tripadvisor that it´s more silent and it´s true, no sound disturbed my sleep. Bed and pillows are very comfortable and towels are new and soft. Wi-fi works very well and I loved the iPod Speaker! Good air conditioner. It´s really a good place to stay near Atocha station, Reina Sofia museum and Parque del Retiro. Cons: in fact it´s only one. It´s a little bit strange that there is no door separating the bedroom from the bathroom, just a curtain. I definetely would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Stay in Chic&basic Atocha”
Reviews.Author: Kennythedub
Reviews.Content: Good hotel for small price.Free internet in foyer was great and breakfast(fruit,croissant and a drink left at your door each morning was brilliant!)A 5 minute walk from metro and 10 minute walk to Madrid old town.Had no problems with noise at all in the hotel and would recommend this hotel as good clean and cheap place to stay ..............and hope to stay there again!!....ps.........very helpful staff!!

Reviews.Title: “Basic but fun and comfy”
Reviews.Author: ziachecca
Reviews.Content: The room we had wasn't very big, but the bed was extremely comfortable and that is what really matters. I really enjoyed the breakfast pack they hang on your door in the mornings. My only complain is that they are a bit noisy in the morning, and if you try to enjoy Madrid night life you won't like that! ;) All members of staff have been very helpful providing any sort of information (restaurants booking, etc...) but I have to admit in Madrid people are generally lovely! ps. some reviews mention the lack of a door separating bedroom and bathroom...that is false, at least for what regarded our room, which was provided one!

Reviews.Title: “Do not buy early bird specials if you intend to change.”
Reviews.Author: FreeSpirit098
Reviews.Content: Just hope that yo udo not need to change your travel plans if you pay in advance. They consider any changes as cancellation. So the number of days you pay in advance is considered deposit. You will lose it. They need to bold their policies as it is not cleared for changes.....Very shady! I hope you do not encountered the same issue we did.

Reviews.Title: “The name says it all!”
Reviews.Author: joy604
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Chic and Basic Atocha for 4 nights in November. The name sums it up nicely. The hotel doesn't have a lot of bells and whistles, but it is very comfortable and a great base to explore the city. The decor was minimalist but the room was very comfortable. However, be aware that there is a curtain instead of a bathroom door. This might be awkward if sharing the room with someone else. The breakfast (croissant, fruit and juice) was a nice touch and the free coffee in the lobby was a great bonus. The hotel was a great value and I would stay at a Chic & Basic again. I would recommend the hotel for travlellers who are looking for a simple, straightforward hotel on a budget.

Reviews.Title: “awesome”
Reviews.Author: deepti2501
Reviews.Content: the hotel was nice and comfortable, the rooms a little small, but it was awesome. The location is great. there is kitchen and food/ sandwiches, water, juice, etc that you can use the whole day. rooms are extremely clean

Reviews.Title: “Need more attention to maintenance details”
Reviews.Author: tinava
Reviews.Content: What I liked: Small modern hotel, front desk friendly. Small intimate lobby Good location . Walking distance to station, museums, metro stop and not too far from Barrio de Las Letras and Mercado San Miguel (great tapas there). Our room was all white and very spartan which is great at packing time, you can immediately notice if you are leaving something behind. We had balcony to the busy street, but the noise was muffled. I also liked very much the cappuccino machine in the lobby. It makes a fresh ground cup of coffee in no time. What i did not like. Size; even though I requested the L room (Large) It was small. Lack of bathroom privacy.The shower door can also be used as a bathroom door, which may give you some privacy, but not much. Maintenance. The shower threshold trim was rotten and looked moldy. Kind of yucky especially in all white room (mentioned to the maid how terrible that looked and next day it was removed). Price/Value. In my opinion 99 Eu. (on promotion) was too much for this room. I would recommend this hotel, but at a lower price. The photos on line look great. What sold me was the terrace photo. But in the end this spot was very hot and we did not use it. I am not even sure if it belongs to the room next to it or it is open to all guests..

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel of our trip!”
Reviews.Author: prairiegirl1527
Reviews.Content: We arrived in Madrid in the early morning and due to our poor map reading abilities, got lost during the extremely short distance from the train station to the hotel. Once we made our way there though - WOW! The hotel was amazing. Clean lines, welcoming entry, great service. We got upgraded for free, and our rooms overlooking the streets of Madrid were clean, luxurious, and just what we needed after exploring the city on foot for three days. This hotel also wins in terms of extras. Free Wi-Fi, free breakfast, loan of travel books for the day or more in case you forgot them, computers in the lobby, great advice on where to go and what to see from the staff, and a delicious and free coffee machine in the front. Oh yeah - and did I mention the rooftop balcony where it seemed we were the only ones to go go. Great view of the city, and a nice place to chill out with some wine before heading out again at night. Far and away this was the best hotel we stayed at throughout our 3 week trip through Spain. I'd recommend it in a flash.

Reviews.Title: “Unique concept, great value”
Reviews.Author: timandprue
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located right near (about 10 mins walk) the Atocha train station, which suited us. We only stayed overnight and this hotel was perfect. Love the unique white rooms and the way they market the hotel as "chic and basic". That it was. Great value for money and perfect for a discerning traveller on a budget. Breakfast is delivered to the room and is a little pack you can take with you.

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: rindarah
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in November 2009 and I think it was a relatively new hotel. Everything was very clean. No frills in this hotel, but it has all the basics. There is a nice beverage area in the small lobby with complimentary water and a great cappuccino machine. There is also a laptop with internet connection for the guest's use. We had a good experience with the staff, for the most part, they were helpful. Our room was all white, with the exception of the bright lime green walls in the bathroom. Just a heads up that the sink and shower are in a small open space (no door). The bathroom area was quite tight, but we were fine with it, especially considering the great rate (we booked a special for $45/night). This also included a breakfast bag that the staff drops off at your door (includes juice, breakfast bar and fruit). The location was very central, within walking distance to Prado and Sofia museums. Very good value. We would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Nice&basic rooms, very good value for money”
Reviews.Author: grenelle90
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I stayed at Chic&Basic Atocha in Madrid for the Easter week-end in April 2010. We checked in late, around midnight, and that was no problem. We booked an M room (medium). It was actually quite small, but very clean and quite modern in decorations and design. The location is good: close to Reina Sofia and Prado and a few subway stops from the city center. The service is also remarkable. There's no space for a breaskfast room, but guests get a bag with croissant, fruit and juice every morning. The value for money is very high when compared to other European cities.

Reviews.Title: “comfortable and chic”
Reviews.Author: citygirl035
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night and found the room very comfortable with a decent amount of space for the (very affordable) price. I liked the white, clean design of the room and that we had balcony doors that we could open for fresh air. The bed was very comfortable and the room very quiet - we were not facing Atocha which probably helped. We also liked that a breakfast snack (croissant, juice & fruit) came with our stay. The hotel is very well positioned being only about a 10+ minute walk to the Prado museum and even closer to the Atocha train station. It is also in easy walking distance to the more historic center of Madrid. Front desk staff were also quite helpful, and all of them were fluent English speakers. The only thing worth noting is that there is no bathroom door, just a sliding canvas screen that serves as a door - so not the most private bathroom experience. Other than that, we liked the hotel quite a bit and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, pity about the noise from the street.”
Reviews.Author: Olimur
Reviews.Content: We also stayed in a room which overlooked Calle Atocha, room 201 and the noise was pretty bad all night long, but considering we knew booking the hotel that it was on a busy street we didn't feel we had the right to complain. It was a bright airy room with a large comfortable bed and we really enjoyed our stay there. The staff were friendly and the breakfast was left on the door-handle each morning. The facilities are basic and certainly more funky than chic. A door on the toilet wouldn't have been too hard to install and perhaps secondary glazing but the location was a perfect base for touring Madrid and getting an early morning train from Atocha station. I would go back there again but check if an internal room was an option.

Reviews.Title: “DO NOT GET ROOM ON THE STREET- extremely noisy! internal rooms great though”
Reviews.Author: crocodilla
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights. The first night we were on level 1 right on the street. We barely had any sleep. Ok the traffic noise we might have got used to but the drunks outside in the street singing, screaming and banging on stuff was unbearable. The wifi in this room also did not work. We moved to an internal room on the 5th floor on the 2nd night and slept like babies. The rooms were clean and comfortable. Just BEWARE the street noise. I would not stay here again if I could not get an internal room. They should price them differently.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, staff, amenities, price...”
Reviews.Author: eyelanddoc
Reviews.Content: Good location - one minute walk to atocha station/reina sofia, close to Prado - everything in walking distance. First class staff - english spoken, great suggestions on restaurants. Rooms simple and clean - quite large. Privacy may be an issue for some travellers (no bathroom door - just a curtain). No alarm clock/clock. Nice roof terrace. Free tea/coffee/hot cocoa, internet, wi-fi. Not a 5-star hotel but great for budget travellers! Definitely would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “basic white room, and quiet!”
Reviews.Author: from
Reviews.Content: We wanted to be very close to the major museums, and that was certainly the case. 5 minutes to the Reina Sofia, 10 minutes walking slowly to the far end of the Prado. Many interesting tapas restaurants nearby in the Huertas area. The hotel is between two subway stations, and close to the Atocha train station. However stairs seem to be the norm in the Madrid metro rather than escalators, so yes it is always best to pack light. The lounge on the ground floor was a real help - coffee or tea anytime, free internet workstations, the Herald Tribune etc. I noticed some people brought their breakfast bags to the lounge in the morning to augment with hot drinks. The breakfast bags included a piece of fruit, a croissant and a bottle of very good juice. No tea kettle in the room, but we took thermoses downstairs to get hot water from the lounge in order to have tea in the room. The staff had excellent English. Not a lot of coat hangers or storage space in the room, but we had only a 3 night stay. The free wifi went completely down on our last evening, and the internet generally went down for half an hour or so. I feel the staff did their best to try to fix it, but as the technician did not seem to want to return to the hotel, it was not resolved that evening. The toilet and shower are separate, and the sink is kind of in a corner of the room. I believe our room was 61, and it was very quiet - which was a major prior concern for me. It is facing the (tiny) elevator, but there did not seem much traffic in the winter season.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: arubiadebs
Reviews.Content: Perfect location close to public transport. A new hotel, so everything is clean. Basic breakfast. Laptops for use in reception. Nice help yourself coffee and water at reception. Would stay again and recommend if looking for a clean, central hotel with no frills.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stuff. Clean, simple, and good value. And in a great location.”
Reviews.Author: DJ_Uhu
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed a four night stay at Chic&Basic Atocha recently, and have already recommended it to our friends and family. The hotel is indeed basic, but then it makes no claims to be anything else, and having seemingly only opened this summer, it is certainly still very clean. It represents excellent value, particularly when you take into account its excellent location, near to the major galleries (Prado, Sofia Reina, Thyssen), and the Parque del Retiro, Plaza Mayor, Plaza Santa Ana, La Latina district etc. The staff were very friendly, which always helps.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Value”
Reviews.Author: teamgrrr
Reviews.Content: We wanted to stay at a place that was near the Metro line and close to the major sights. This hotel has all that. We were able to walk to all the museums, Plaza Mayor and Plaza Santa Ana. It is a great location with easy access to the Metro. They are on point when they say the hotel is 'basic.' The rooms are nice overall, but not always totally clean. We checked in and noticed that our room was dirty. Unfortunately it was the afternoon and their cleaning person had left. The manager was nice enough to change our room and we were very appreciative. Would definitely recommend to stay here for the value and location. Plus it was great to have free wifi in our rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay - clean, comfortable, secure and central”
Reviews.Author: MDC79
Reviews.Content: We came to Madrid for a 3 day weekend and booked this new hotel on a deal via Travelzoo. We were delighted with the hotel. It is exactly as the name suggests, basic ut chic. Everything was clean, new and modern. The rooms are large and quiet, the beds spacious and comfortable. When we booked, we asked for a room away from street noise and were very pleased to find when we checked in, this request had been accomodated and we had a room on the top floor. There is 24 hour reception and the staff were always pleasant and helpful. There is a lounge on the ground level where you can help yourself to barrista coffee, hot chocolate, iced water or ice cubes at all hours. You are also left a small bag of breakfast outside your room each morning containing 2 pastries, 2 juices and 2 pieces of fruit. Whilst this may not be as an extravagent a breakfast as some may need to kick start their day' it certainly is a good start or makes for good food to pack and take with you on your day trips. Not only would we stay here again, we will now look up other chic and basic hotels in the chain when we are travelling. There are also 2 laptops with free laptop accesible to all in reception, as well as free wifi through out (although as we were staying on the 6th floor - we found the signal was too weak for us to access it up there). No problem though as we just used the free computers downstairs instead.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent! Value, Location. Service, Style...”
Reviews.Author: KJKR
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from a wkend in Madrid having hopped over form the UK to see Leonard Cohen in concert. I wanted somewhere fairly central and within easy walking distance of some key sights and good cafes/restaurants. I searched for ages before I came across this little boutique hotel and it was a great find. Not only is it within easy walking distance of the main tube station (SOL) and the Centro de Arte Reina Sofia ( a five minute walk) but it was great value to - only 75 euros for a double room. Rooms are basic, but modern - stark white interior, small and although our room had no real view it has to be said that when you're our for most of the day/night and you're looking for somewhere that is modern in style without any fuss and with an impeccable service the this is the place. Breakfast consists of a paper bag with croissants, fruit and OJ and there's plenty of free coffee and water in the lobby area! A great little gem of a place!
